Description: Fragment of neck and shoulder of North Ionian(?) Late Wild Goat style black-figured pottery krater(?); interior: neck glazed, body reserved; exterior: on neck, frieze of tongues; on shoulder grazing deer to left, rosettes as filling ornaments.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 49 no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.880)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: II 6 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
